Legal_Issue: Was the member's decision to deny the reopening of the refugee claim reasonable?
Application_Facts: Applicant failed to submit a Basis of Claim form within the required timeframe, despite being informed of deadlines and having access to legal counsel and an interpreter.
Court_Ruling: The application for judicial review was dismissed as the member's decision was found reasonable.
Assessment_Factor: Access to legal counsel and interpreter
Applicable_Legislation: subsection 72(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Procedural_Issue: Failure to file Basis of Claim form on time
Evidence_Used: Availability of legal counsel and interpreter
Evidence_Assessed: Applicantâ€™s awareness of deadlines and support resources
Governing_Rule: Decisions by the Refugee Protection Division are reviewable under the standard of reasonableness.
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to submit required documentation (Basis of Claim form)
Cause_Description: Applicant's failure to meet filing deadlines led to abandonment of their refugee claim.
Legal_Provision_Violated: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act procedural requirements
Evidence_Assessment: Sufficient reasons provided for denying reopening
Decision_Rationale: Applicant had access to resources and was informed of deadlines; failure to comply unjustified
